title: SM UC-31
text:
SM "UC-31" was a German <a href="German%20Type%20UC%20II%20submarine">Type UC II</a> <a href="minelayer">minelaying</a> <a href="submarine">submarine</a> or <a href="U-boat">U-boat</a> in the <a href="German%20Imperial%20Navy">German Imperial Navy</a> () during <a href="World%20War%20I">World War I</a>. The U-boat was ordered on 29 August 1915 and was <a href="Ceremonial%20ship%20launching">launch</a>ed on 7 August 1916. She was <a href="Ship%20commissioning">commission</a>ed into the German Imperial Navy on 2 September 1916 as SM "UC-31". In 13 patrols "UC-31" was credited with sinking 38 ships, either by torpedo or by <a href="naval%20mines">mines</a> laid. "UC-31" was surrendered on 26 November 1918 and <a href="ship%20breaking">broken up</a> at <a href="Canning%20Town">Canning Town</a> in 1922.
Design.
A <a href="German%20Type%20UC%20II%20submarine">German Type UC II submarine</a>, "UC-31" had a displacement of when at the surface and while submerged. She had a <a href="length%20overall">length overall</a> of , a <a href="beam%20%28ship%29">beam</a> of , and a <a href="draught%20%28ship%29">draught</a> of . The submarine was powered by two six-cylinder four-stroke diesel engines each producing (a total of ), two <a href="electric%20motor">electric motor</a>s producing , and two <a href="propeller%20shaft">propeller shaft</a>s. She had a dive time of 48 seconds and was capable of operating at a depth of .
The submarine had a maximum surface speed of and a submerged speed of . When submerged, she could operate for at ; when surfaced, she could travel at . "UC-31" was fitted with six mine tubes, eighteen UC 200 mines, three <a href="torpedo%20tube">torpedo tube</a>s (one on the stern and two on the bow), seven torpedoes, and one <a href="8.8%20cm%20SK%20L/30%20naval%20gun">Uk L/30</a> <a href="deck%20gun">deck gun</a>. Her <a href="Ship%27s%20company">complement</a> was twenty-six crew members.
